intro: Peristylus natalensis, commonly known as Natal star-of-Bethleham, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bloom during the warmer months. Peristylus natalensis is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and horticultural collections.
